title: Sauce tureen with arms of van Reverhorst
text: It was rare for a "gentleman" to be able to claim that all eight great-grandparents were also titled, as was the case for Aadrian and Theodorus van Raverhorst.  Both brothers were active in the Dutch East India Company, which may have led one of them to order a dinner service celebrating their ancestry.
description: cover: arms of Van Revenhorst surrounded by coronet and winged horse crest, within eight named armorials and flower scrolls; sauceboat: two handles; gilt and red floral designs at interior and exterior
creditline: Gift of Leo and Doris Hodroff
